definition[0]: to stop doing something or stop happening
note[0]: cease fire! (=used to order soldiers to stop shooting)
example[0]: The rain ceased and the sky cleared.
example[1]: The company ceased production at their Norwich plant last year.
example[2]: He ceased to be a member of the association.
example[3]: The things people will do for charity never cease to amaze me (=I am always surprised by them).
example[4]: the decision to cease using CFCs in packaging
explanation[0]: In everyday English, people usually use stop rather than cease:
example[5]: They have stopped using CFCs in packaging.
example[6]: The rain stopped just as the fireworks began.
